Public-Self:SELF.get_state:(INTEGER,INTEGER,UINTEGER_8)// Retrieve the current state of the mouse.
 The current button state is returned as a button bitmask, which can
 be tested using the SDL_BUTTON(X) macros, and x and y are set to the
 current mouse cursor position.  You can pass NULL for either x or y.
Public-Self:SELF.get_relative_state:(INTEGER,INTEGER,UINTEGER_8)// Retrieve the current state of the mouse.
 The current button state is returned as a button bitmask, which can
 be tested using the SDL_BUTTON(X) macros, and x and y are set to the
 mouse deltas since the last call to SDL_GetRelativeMouseState().
Public-Self:SELF.warp (:UINTEGER_16,:UINTEGER_16) // Set the position of the mouse cursor (generates a mouse motion event)
Public-Self:SELF.show_cursor :INTEGER :BOOLEAN// Toggle whether or not the cursor is shown on the screen.
 The cursor start displayed, but can be turned off.
  returns TRUE if the cursor was being displayed
 before the call, or FALSE if it was not. You can query the current
 state by passing a  value of -1.
